message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
while(itr1.hasNext() && itr2.hasNext()) {
    String str1 = itr1.next();
    String str2 = itr2.next();
    if(str1.compareTo(str2) <= 0) {
        L3.add(str1);
        if(str1.compareTo(str2) == 0) {
            L3.add(str2);
        } else {
            itr2.previous();
        }
    } else {
        L3.add(str2);
        itr1.previous();
    }
}
while(itr1.hasNext()) {
    L3.add(itr1.next());
}
while(itr2.hasNext()) {
    L3.add(itr2.next());
}
return L3;
<<<explanation>>>: The while loop iterates through both lists at the same time. If the string from the first list is less than or equal to the string from the second list, it adds the string from the first list to the result list. If the strings are equal, it also adds the string from the second list. If the string from the first list is greater, it adds the string from the second list and goes back one step in the first list. After the loop, it adds the remaining elements from the list that still has elements.
